text:
Frame 1
- State: Robot is at a central/home observation pose facing the workspace. Gripper is open. A white plastic drawer unit is on the right side of the workspace. No contact with objects; workspace in front of the robot is clear.
- Action: Transition to observation/setup pose (no manipulation yet).

Strategy assessment
- The behavior so far matches an initialization/observation step. No failure mode is apparent in this single frame.

High‑level next steps
- Perceive and localize the intended target (e.g., the drawer handle/lip or any object to be grasped).
- Plan an approach with appropriate pre‑grasp offset and orientation, ensuring clearance from the drawer frame and table.
- Move to the pre‑grasp pose, close the gripper to secure the target, then execute the manipulation (e.g., pull to open or lift/place).
- Monitor force/position; if contact or slip is detected, back off, adjust pose, and retry.

If additional keyframes exist, please share them so I can provide a complete frame‑by‑frame state‑action description and a more precise diagnosis.
